witnesses.name: Demenge Jacot Cole
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: father-in-law of accused's deceased daughter Nicole

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused angry about son-in-law's poverty and demand for promised marriage portion; accused daughter and sister of stealing from his coffers after death of first wife
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il auroit sadite fille en main, ou passeroit par ses mains

harms_alleged.target: Nicole (daughter of accused, wife of Claudon Haiatte)
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: shortly afterwards fell ill, recovered briefly, then died 10 months later after harvest quarrel

testimony.quarrel_subject: Told accused his daughter might be unhappy he hadn't given her marriage portion and had remarried
testimony.threat_quote: jurer la mort, la teste Nre Seigneur qu'elle s'en repentiroit, l'auroit, et passeroit par ses mains

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: illness followed until Whitsun, then recurred after corn theft incident

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused quarreled with son-in-law Nicolas Petit Homme, calling him thief and bad man
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il estoit un sorcier, qu'il avoit ja fait mourir ses trois autres filles, qu'il face encore mourir la derniere sa femme, et puis qu'il n'en auroit plus du tout

witnesses.name: Nicolas Pirot
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: son of someone who quarreled with accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Same quarrel as witness 3 with Nicolas Petit Homme

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: result of quarrel between Demenge and his father

testimony.quarrel_subject: Quarrel with son-in-law Nicolas Petit Homme and daughter Jennon
testimony.threat_quote: que quand il voudroit il les feroit tous mourir

testimony.quarrel_subject: Similar to witness 6
Asked Demenge to grind wheat finely for newborn baby; Demenge refused rudely

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same hour as quarrel about 100 sheaves

testimony.quarrel_subject: Demenge threatened Magdelaine over alleged theft of his dog

harms_alleged.target: Magdelaine wife of Jeandat tabellion of Sercoeur
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: dislocated ankle at veilles of Fontenay on St. Laurent's Day

testimony.quarrel_subject: Niece demanded cloth owed for her service; Demenge was angry

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: sickened and died after leaving service

testimony.quarrel_subject: Lease dispute at mill of Sercoeur

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after lease surrender; mill made noise like 50 drums, horse fled

witnesses.name: Jacote femme de Claudon du Pore

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: left service with illness, died two years later

testimony.quarrel_subject: Demenge owed daughter a couvrechef (head covering), only gave it after threat of legal action
Refused to sell horse at price demanded
testimony.threat_quote: la mort de nre Seigneur, because he didn't want to sell at that price, within 6 weeks horse would not be worth 4 ecus

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: within 6 weeks; became sick and killed as enraged

testimony.quarrel_subject: Told Claudate Durant about accused's criminal family history when she was considering marriage to him; she married him anyway and told accused what witness had said

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: within a couple of days of quarrel

testimony.quarrel_subject: Father secured lease of mills at Sercoeur and Dompierre previously held by Demenge

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 13-14 years ago; strange illness making him 'hors de soy'; struck on shoulder by Demenge

testimony.quarrel_subject: Father had dispute with Demenge 25 years earlier while levying tithe for curé
Demenge wanted husband to sublet mill of Dompierre

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: became ill and died 2 days after Whitsun, 24 years earlier

testimony.quarrel_subject: Several quarrels with Demenge
Demenge's dog was in their house; he called her 'carogne' for keeping it

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 9-10 months earlier; sprained ankle on return from Veilles of Fontenay

witnesses.name: Dieudonné femme de Demenge Drouin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: husband obtained lease previously held by accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband obtained lease of mill at Sercoeur previously held by Demenge

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: died suddenly, 7 years after lease obtained

testimony.quarrel_subject: Leased mill of Dompierre; Demenge was angry, claimed witness was encroaching on his business

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: During next 3 years, so many breakdowns they had to abandon lease and cede back to Demenge

timeline.subject: Bastienne veuve Jean Brihey d'Aydoille

timeline.subject: Demenge Demongeot
timeline.details: Confrontation with Adam who maintains charges; accused denies firmly

timeline.subject: Demenge Demongeot
timeline.details: Information by George Milot, Prévôt de Bruyères - witness depositions begin

timeline.details: Adam repeats accusations against Demengeon and Thomasse at stake

timeline.subject: Demenge Demongeot
timeline.details: First interrogation; accused denies all charges

timeline.subject: Demenge Demongeot
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; accused denies allegations

timeline.subject: Demenge Demongeot
timeline.details: PG des Vosges requests question ordinaire et extraordinaire, with moderation due to great age

timeline.subject: Demenge Demongeot
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; full battery applied; stubbornly denied guilt throughout

timeline.subject: Demenge Demongeot
timeline.details: PG des Vosges orders he be renvoyé (released), subject to payment of costs

timeline.subject: Demenge Demongeot
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves release but orders he should not be liable for costs

timeline.subject: Demenge Demongeot
timeline.details: Prisoner released without payment of costs

torture.restrictions: moderation appropriate to great age of accused

accomplices_named.context: Named by Bastienne at execution; already imprisoned

accomplices_named.name: Nicolas Adam (Colas Adam)
accomplices_named.context: Named by Bastienne at execution; also accused Demenge and maintained charges in confrontation

accomplices_named.name: Woman of Rompchamps called le Poil

accomplices_named.name: Georgatte (daughter of accused)
accomplices_named.context: Bastienne claimed daughter was a witch

accomplices_named.context: Bastienne claimed daughter-in-law was a witch

prior_accusations.context: Accused Demenge at her execution on 6 November 1619
Maintained accusations in confrontation on 11 February 1620; repeated at stake on 19 February 1620

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Demongeot
notable_quotes.french: qu'il auroit sadite fille en main, ou passeroit par ses mains
notable_quotes.english: that he would have his said daughter in hand, or she would pass through his hands
notable_quotes.context: Threat to daughter Nicole regarding marriage portion dispute

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Demongeot
notable_quotes.french: jurer la mort, la teste Nre Seigneur qu'elle s'en repentiroit, l'auroit, et passeroit par ses mains
notable_quotes.english: swearing death, by the head of Our Lord that she would repent it, he would have her, and she would pass through his hands
notable_quotes.context: Threat to daughter regarding marriage portion

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Petit Homme (son-in-law)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il estoit un sorcier, qu'il avoit ja fait mourir ses trois autres filles, qu'il face encore mourir la derniere sa femme, et puis qu'il n'en auroit plus du tout
notable_quotes.english: that he was a sorcerer, that he had already made his three other daughters die, let him also make the last one his wife die, and then he would have none at all
notable_quotes.context: Son-in-law's response to being called thief

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Demongeot
notable_quotes.french: que quand il voudroit il les feroit tous mourir
notable_quotes.english: that when he wanted he would make them all die
notable_quotes.context: Threat to son-in-law Nicolas Petit Homme and daughter Jennon

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Demongeot
notable_quotes.french: la mort de nre Seigneur, because he didn't want to sell at that price, within 6 weeks horse would not be worth 4 ecus
notable_quotes.english: by the death of our Lord, because he didn't want to sell at that price, within 6 weeks the horse would not be worth 4 ecus
notable_quotes.context: Threat/curse regarding Mongeon Antoine Toussainct's horse sale refusal

notable_quotes.speaker: Claudate Durant (later wife of accused)
notable_quotes.french: que s'il avoit esté d'or elle ne l'epouseroit pas et qu'il vaudroit bien mieux qu'elle s'allit noier
notable_quotes.english: that if he had been made of gold she would not marry him and that it would be much better if she went and drowned herself
notable_quotes.context: Response after learning about Demenge's criminal family history; she married him anyway

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicolas Jean Ferry
notable_quotes.french: s'il eut esté sorcier et eu pouvoir sur luy il ne seroit aujordhuy vivant, veu l'Inimitié qu'ils se sont entreportés
notable_quotes.english: if he had been a sorcerer and had power over him he would not be alive today, given the enmity they have borne each other
notable_quotes.context: Demenge's defense: if he were truly a witch, his enemy would be dead

notable_quotes.speaker: Nicole (daughter of accused)
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle avoit laissé le mal chez sondit pere au molin, ou elle avoit fait bonne chere et beaucoup beu
notable_quotes.english: that she had left the illness at her said father's mill, where she had good cheer and drank much
notable_quotes.context: After temporary recovery at Whitsun following visit to father

relationships.evidence_text: his daughter Jennon, wife of Nicolas Petit Homme
Jacote femme de Claudon du Pore
two of his cousins hanged at Fontenoy

economic_context.details: Demenge was a miller who lost multiple mill leases (Sercoeur, Dompierre) to other millers, creating economic rivalries. He sold land before trial, claiming to pay debts to prévôt of Epinal and merchants. Disputes over marriage portions owed to daughters. Disputes over wages/goods owed to servants (cloth/couvrechef). Horse trading disputes. Mill lease disputes created significant animosity with multiple witnesses who took over his business.

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: daughter-in-law to witness 1; cousin's wife to witness 2
harms_catalog.harm_description: Languishing illness with two phases: first lasted until Whitsun, temporary recovery, then recurred and she died 10 months after initial onset
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused angry about daughter's poverty and demands for promised marriage portion; accused her of stealing from his coffers with her sister
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: shortly afterwards; temporary recovery after eating/drinking with father; relapse after harvest quarrel about stolen corn

harms_catalog.harm_description: Same illness as above, with detail that she 'left the illness at her father's mill' after recovery
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Witness told accused daughter might be unhappy about lack of marriage portion and his remarriage

harms_catalog.harm_description: Affliction in legs requiring crutches when he was 12; cured after Demenge told him he would be cured
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel between Demenge and witness's father
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Demenge told him he would be cured and he recovered - suggesting Demenge caused and removed the affliction

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Asked Demenge to grind wheat finely for baby; Demenge refused rudely 'repartit en le rebrouant pour le diable'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Mare became ill and had to be destroyed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Demenge reproached wife about story of 100 missing sheaves; wife denied it
Threat over alleged theft of his dog
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: at veilles of Fontenay on St. Laurent's Day

harms_catalog.victim_name: Niece of Nicolas Jean Blot (servant of accused)
harms_catalog.harm_description: Sickened and died two years after leaving service
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Demanded cloth still due for her service; Demenge was angry
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: sickened after leaving service, died 2 years later

harms_catalog.harm_description: Corn would not mill properly, made noise like 50 drums, horse broke away and fled to village
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Lease dispute at mill of Sercoeur; witness claimed he wanted to back out of surrender

harms_catalog.victim_name: Daughter of Jacote and Claudon du Pore
harms_catalog.harm_description: Left service with illness, died two years later
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Unknown to witness 12; witness 13 specifies owed couvrechef dispute
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: left service 10-12 years before, died 2 years after leaving

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Demenge owed daughter a couvrechef, only gave it after father threatened legal action

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became sick and had to be killed 'comme enragé' (as if rabid)
harms_catalog.economic_value: worth 18 ecus when healthy, predicted to be worth only 4 ecus within 6 weeks
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to sell horse at demanded price (18 ecus) to Nicolas Claude courretier
Witness told Claudate Durant about Demenge's criminal family history, discouraging marriage; she married him anyway and told Demenge; quarrel ensued

harms_catalog.harm_description: Strange illness making him 'hors de soy' (out of his mind)
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Father secured lease of mills at Sercoeur and Dompierre previously held by Demenge; Demenge struck him on shoulder pretending to wish him good health
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 13-14 years ago at next Whitsun; died 2 days after Whitsun

harms_catalog.victim_name: Father of Nicolas Rouvier (husband of witness 19)
harms_catalog.harm_description: Became ill and died 2 days after Whitsun
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Demenge wanted husband to sublet mill of Dompierre; arranged to meet at veilles
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: became ill before veilles meeting; died 2 days after Whitsun (24 years earlier per witness 19)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Sprained ankle on return from Veilles of Fontenoy
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: His dog was in their house, couldn't chase it away; he called her 'carogne'
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: 9-10 months earlier; did not see Demenge at Fontenoy or on road

harms_catalog.victim_name: 13-year-old son of Dieudonné and Demenge Drouin
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Husband obtained lease of mill at Sercoeur previously held by Demenge; he was angry

harms_catalog.victim_name: Son-in-law of Dieudonné and Demenge Drouin
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: sometime after lease obtained 7 years earlier

harms_catalog.harm_description: So many breakdowns over 3 years that they had to abandon lease and cede back to Demenge
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Nicolas le Conte leased mill; Demenge angry, complained witness was encroaching on his business after he held it 45 years continuously

used to transport injured woman from veilles

witness tried to hit Demenge with handle

father levying tithe for curé 25 years earlier

Where accused lodged while hiding; residence of witness; courretier from there
Veilles held there on St. Laurent's Day; location where injury occurred
Where accused's uncle and two cousins were hanged
Residence of witnesses whose father died after mill dispute
Residence of Nicolas le Conte who leased mill
Location of Bastienne who accused Demenge at execution
Location of woman called le Poil accused by Bastienne
Where father of woman called le Poil was executed; accused owed debts to prévôt there
Mill leased by accused, then by others; site of disputes
Mill leased by accused for 45 years continuously; later by others; site of disputes
Where accused stayed night while fleeing
Where witness was threshing when accused came to quarrel
Accused 'tenu et frequenté craintivement les bois' while hiding

Debts to merchants and prévôt of Epinal
Sale of land to pay debts
Mill lease disputes due to lack of profit

officials_named.name: Substitut of procureur general des Vosges

prior_legal_disputes.description: Father of witness 13 threatened to take accused to court over owed couvrechef

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Not specified, but released without payment of costs

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Local court (PG des Vosges) ordered release subject to payment of costs; Change de Nancy approved release but ordered he should not be liable for costs

hearsay_chains.content: Magdelaine suspected Demenge of causing dislocated ankle
Demenge was frightened by accusation and spent night away
Niece said Demenge gave her illness over cloth dispute
Father called Demenge witch 25 years earlier
Marriage proposal and information about family; she told Demenge what witness said

emotional_state_notes: Frightened of arrest - absented himself for night and a half
Hiding in woods ('tenu et frequenté craintivement les bois')
'Espouvanté' by accusations according to miller's wife
Sold land and removed property via family members before arrest

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Accused Jean fils Jean Mongin of being thief and son of murderer
Claimed he said they desired his death, and perhaps theirs would arrive first
Claimed Jean Clerc caused mill breakage himself; was angry at being sacked and threw 'un paulx' into machinery

extraction_metadata.notes: Exceptionally well-documented trial with 23 witnesses providing detailed testimony. Accused was at least 80 years old. Notable for RELEASE outcome despite extensive witness testimony, prior accusations by executed witches, and full torture. Demenge maintained innocence throughout. Complex economic context involving multiple mill lease disputes. Long reputation (25 years). Family history of executions. Pattern of quarrels over economic matters (marriage portions, debts, wages, mill leases) followed by harms. Change de Nancy ordered release without costs, unusual outcome suggesting insufficient evidence despite reputation and accusations.
